Following the [Linux build instructions](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/linux.md#custom-build-directory), passing the [build directory](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/linux.md#custom-build-directory), the Node.js modules are installed in the source directory.

```
$ /dev/shm/bee-root/atom/atom-1.8.0-0/source/script/build --build-dir /dev/shm/bee-root/atom/atom-1.8.0-0/build

Run script/bootstrap to install Grunt
$ cd /dev/shm/bee-root/atom/atom-1.8.0-0/
$ find . -name grunt
./source/node_modules/bootstrap/grunt
```

In my opinion, the `build` directory should have been put into `/dev/shm/bee-root/atom/atom-1.8.0-0/build`.

data.title: Python syntax highlighting can be broken by quoting 'DELETE' in a docstring
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I can cause the python syntax highlighting to render everything as a string (in green, by default) with the following python code:

```
class SomeClass:

    """This is a docstring with 'DELETE' in the first line.

    If the docstring contains another single quote anywhere in the body the
    rest of this file will be highlighted correctly.
    """

    def foo(self):
        pass # this should not be rendered in green!
```

Atom renders this like so:

![broken screenshot](http://static.inky.ws/image/5776/Screenshot%20from%202016-07-12%2013-21-57.png)

The key here seems to be that you need the word `DELETE` in either single quotes, double quotes, or backticks. `DELETE` by itself (i.e.- unquoted) is not enough to break the syntax highlighting. I've not found any other words that seem to produce this behaviour (I thought perhaps it was all HTTP methods, but PUT, GET, HEAD, etc don't trigger the same behaviour).  It's also curious that `DELETE` is rendered as a keyword here, when it probably shouldn't be.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Copy the above snippet into a file ending in '.py'
2. Open the file in atom.

**Expected behaviour:** 

I expect everything past the first docstring to render correctly (i.e.- not as if it were all one large string).

**Actual behaviour:** 

See screenshot above.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11+
git 2.7.4

Operating system is Ubuntu 16.04, with all packages up to date.

data.title: Prevent command-w/ctrl-w closing windows
data.body:
### Description

In Atom, ctrl-w closes both tabs and windows. Sometimes I want to close all tabs in my window, but leave the window open for later. It's surprising (and annoying) when I hold down command-w and all my tabs close, follow by the window.

I would find the UI more consistent if you needed ctrl-shift-w to close an editor window. This is not the same behaviour as eg a web browser, but it is consistent with IDEs in particular.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open an Atom window
2. Open two tabs in the window
3. Press command-w / ctrl-w three times

**Expected behavior:** All tabs closed but editor window is open.

**Actual behavior:** Editor window is closed.
### Versions

Atom 1.8.0

data.title: Option for toggling undo history persistence over multiple sessions
data.body:
Since around release 1.7.0 or 1.8.0 Atom has started storing undo history over reboots, which is frankly awful way to behave. I could not find any package that would cause this nor is there any way to configure the behavior in the GUI. Therefore I presume it to be hardcoded somewhere in core. I've lost good chunks of code for not realizing my undos are clearing lots of others things too than just my latest debug session.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open a document
2. Type something (and save)
3. Close Atom
4. Open Atom
5. Open the same doc as in step 1
6. Ctrl-Z to undo -> it clears the edits from previous session

data.body:
UPDATE July 29th, 2016

---

**WIN 7 Pro  ... ALL APPS working great on this box EXCEPT ATOM!!!**
after all the steps stated in the many posts below, I am left disappointed...
- Sorry to inform that ATOM is simply a continuing annoying FAIL!
- One never knows when it will start and show the VISUAL interface(window)
- It starts **multiple instances** in the TaskManager with no corresponding visual/window!
- it raises the Processor usage to 100% and peters-out
- Starting it from different shortcuts including via the update.exe type eventually results in windows popping on the screen of which many are untitled and empty, totally bare! an 1 partially remembering the last status

**whateva!**  something is not right about the ATOM editor on WIN

---

**Original post**
**squirrelsetup.log** attached

**My scenario, ex:** WIN7, first install of 1.8.0 atom.exe...

**1. run after install**, luckily I checked it or I would never have even seen the tool.

**2. once I exited**, had no way to start atom!? - no shortcuts ANYWHERE
       - had to do a FileSystem search to find where installed

**3. clicking on atom.exe**
    does nothing
    O! yes it does! it starts it but does not show the visual interface, only shows as an entry in the Task-Manager.!?

**4. going to DOS**
    and using .cmd or atom FAIL (spews 1/2 screen of 'crash' lines on the DOS window and hangs)

**5. context menu(right-click)**
       - **NO (Open with Atom)** even after having manually associated extensions to be ATOM default and icon shows correctly on the file type, like .css, .js, ...
       ...AND THE BAD PART ABOUT THAT
       ...ASSOCIATING .htm/.aspx/.php/etc...simply a CLUMSY APPROACH - GETS IN THE WAY...
          these extensions need to be
         - DefaultBrowser-associated to **EXECUTE**,
         - and instead, **(Open with Atom)** in the context menu!

```
  - **Open with** - Choose default program - Browse to fetch Atom FAILs (as in 4 - above)
     ...2 to 4 clicks and delays - RIDICULOUS
```

**6. adding a registry key,**
      to place (Open with Atom) in the context menu(right-click)
      have not tried that yet, but have had problems with other editors...
      was able to get (Open with notepad2) and (Open with Wordpad) to appear in context menu
     ...but it was a struggle (with Wordpad definitely)
**Will post an update HERE if I succeed with that!  (any suggestions?!)**

**7. made a shortcut:**
   C:\Users\User\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.8.0\atom.exe (with same target)
- that seems to dig the atom from the depth of KLUDGEs...
- atom comes up and shows as was last exited
   and remembers the file displayed is an ASPX which was set as HTML manually or no syntax color would show!   **(wonder if that will stick... where is it stored in the config!?)**

**Thus atom works ok... if use the shortcut.**
